sen.j: 谷川 士清（たにかわ ことすが、1709年4月5日(宝永6年2月26日 (旧暦)) - 1776年11月20日(安永5年10月10日 (旧暦))）は、江戸時代の国学者である。
sen.e: Kotosuga TANIKAWA (born on April 5, 1709 and died on November 20, 1776) was a scholar of Japanese classical culture in the Edo period.
Kotosuga TANIKAWA (April 5, 1709-November 20, 1776) was a scholar of Japanese classical culture in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: born on April 5, 1709 and died on November 20, 1776 をApril 5, 1709-November 20, 1776 に修正しました。
sen.e: Kotosuga TANIKAWA (April 5, 1709-November 20, 1776) was a scholar of Japanese classical culture in the Edo period.
His nickname was Yojun.
His popular name was Yojun.
sen.cmt: nickname を popular name に修正しました。
sen.e: His popular name was Yojun.
The family name was Kokai.
His nickname was Kokai.
sen.cmt: The family name を His nickname に修正しました。
sen.e: His nickname was Kokai.
The family title was Tansai.
His pen name was Tansai.
sen.cmt: The family title を His pen name に修正しました。
sen.e: His pen name was Tansai.

sen.j: 伊勢国の津市（現、三重県津市）の医者の家に生まれた。
sen.e: He was born in a family whose members were all doctors in Tsu City, Ise Province (present-day Tsu City, Mie Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外処理
sen.e: He was born in a family of doctors in Tsu City, Ise Province (present-day Tsu City, Mie Prefecture).
sen.cmt: whose members were all doctors を of doctors に修正しました。
sen.e: He was born in a family of doctors in Tsu City, Ise Province (present-day Tsu City, Mie Prefecture).

sen.j: 京都に出て医学を学ぶ傍ら、玉木葦斎から垂加神道を学ぶ。
sen.e: He went to Kyoto and while learning medical science, he also learned 'Suika Shinto' from Isai TAMAKI..
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外処理
sen.e: While he learned medical science in Kyoto, he also learned Suika Shinto (Shinto thoughts advocated by Ansai YAMAZAKI) from Isai TAMAKI..
sen.cmt: He went to Kyoto and while learning medical science を While he learned medical science in Kyoto に修正しました。'Suika Shinto' を Suika Shinto (Shinto thoughts advocated by Ansai YAMAZAKI) に修正しました。
sen.e: While he learned medical science in Kyoto, he also learned Suika Shinto (Shinto thoughts advocated by Ansai YAMAZAKI) from Isai TAMAKI..

sen.j: 津に帰った後、医業の傍ら、有栖川宮職仁親王から和歌を学び、独学で国学を研究した。
sen.e: After coming back to Tsu, while running medical practice, he also learned waka (a 31-syllable Japanese poem) from Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito and studied Japanese classical culture by himself.

After coming back to Tsu, while running medical practice, he also learned waka (a 31-syllable Japanese poem) from Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito and studied Japanese classical culture by himself.

After coming back to Tsu, while running medical practice, he also learned waka (a 31-syllable Japanese poem) from Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito and studied Japanese classical culture by himself.

sen.j: 士清が国語学に残した功績は大きかった。
sen.e: He accomplished a great achievement in the study of Japanese language.
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外処理
sen.e: He accomplished a great achievement in the study of Japanese language.
He accomplished a great achievement in the study of Japanese language.

sen.j: 彼の著作『日本書紀通証』第1巻に収録した「和語通音」は日本初の動詞活用表であり、また、『和訓栞』は日本初の五十音順に配列された国語辞典であった。
sen.e: He made the first Japanese verb conjugation chart, 'wagotsuon' recorded in his book, "Nihonshoki tsusyo", volume 1 and compiled the first Japanese dictionary arranged in order of the Japanese syllabary, "Wakun no shiori".
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外処理
sen.e: He made the first Japanese verb conjugation chart, 'wagotsuon' recorded in his book, "Nihon Shoki Tsusho" (A Compendium Treatise on Chronicles of Japan) volume 1 and compiled the first Japanese dictionary arranged in order of the Japanese syllabary, "Wakun no shiori."
sen.cmt: 原文 『"Nihon Shoki Tsusho" (A Compendium Treatise on Chronicles of Japan)』 を『和訓栞』 に修正しました。※ウィキペディアの原文を確認したところ、このように記載されていました。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%B0%B7%E5%B7%9D%E5%A3%AB%E6%B8%85"Nihonshoki tsusyo", を"Nihon Shoki Tsusho" (A Compendium Treatise on Chronicles of Japan), に修正しました。shiori". を shiori." に修正しました。
sen.e: He made the first Japanese verb conjugation chart, 'wagotsuon' recorded in his book, "Nihon Shoki Tsusho" (A Compendium Treatise on Chronicles of Japan) volume 1 and compiled the first Japanese dictionary arranged in order of the Japanese syllabary, "Wakun no shiori."

sen.j: ただこの辞典は士清の生存中に全巻を刊行できず、士清の死後、遺族の手によって引き継がれ1887年(明治20年)に全巻刊行された。
sen.e: However, he was not able to publish a complete set of volumes of his dictionary in his lifetime, but after his death, his bereaved family carried out his wishes and published it in 1887.
However, he was not able to publish a complete set of his dictionary in his lifetime, thus his bereaved family carried out his wishes after his death and published it in 1887.
sen.cmt: of volumes を削除しました。but 以下を全文修正しました。
sen.e: However, he was not able to publish a complete set of his dictionary in his lifetime, thus his bereaved family carried out his wishes after his death and published it in 1887.

sen.j: 反面、士清の古典研究は、在来の学説を集成したもので、独創性に乏しいという評価がある。
sen.e: But there is a negative evaluation that his study of classics just compiled the conventional theories without creative and unique theories.
On the other hand, there is a negative evaluation that his study of classics just compiled the conventional theories without creative and unique theories.
sen.cmt: But を On the other hand に修正しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, there is a negative evaluation that his study of classics just compiled the conventional theories without creative and unique theories.

sen.j: また、和語通音を絶賛していた本居宣長からは、垂加神道に基づく古典の解釈がこじつけが多く非学問的だと批判されている。
sen.e: In addition, Norinaga MOTOORI, who gave 'wago tsuon' the highest praise, criticized that his theories were no academic, because there were a lot of strained interpretations about classics based on 'Suika Shinto'.

In addition, Norinaga MOTOORI, who gave wago tsuon the highest praise, criticized that his theories were not academic, because there were a lot of strained interpretations about classics based on Suika Shinto.
sen.cmt: wago tsuon' および 'Suika Shinto' のコーテーションを削除しました。 no academic を not academic に修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, Norinaga MOTOORI, who gave wago tsuon the highest praise, criticized that his theories were not academic, because there were a lot of strained interpretations about classics based on Suika Shinto.

tit.cmt: important work をMain Works に修正しました。

sen.e: "Nihonshoki tsusho"
"Nihon Shoki Tsusho"
sen.cmt: 用語集の表記に修正しました。
sen.e: "Nihon Shoki Tsusho"
"Wakun no shiori"
"Wakun no shiori"
"Wakun no shiori"
"Zoku Dainihonshi shiki"
"Zoku Dainihonshi Shiki" (a commentary on Japanese history)
sen.cmt: 用語集の表記に修正しました。
sen.e: "Zoku Dainihonshi Shiki" (a commentary on Japanese history)
